metadata.synopsis: In this post-credits sequence, Karlach and the player arrive in Avernus. She's still stuck in the middle of the Blood War, but she is, at least, alive. She quickly realizes her engine is 'fixed' as long as she stays down here and rapidly goes through the stages of grief to accpeting that she's back where she swore she'd never go - but at least she's in her element. Kicking ass, fucking shit up - and this  time, she has someone she loves with her. Maybe this could work after all... at least for now.Tone here is optimistic, though ambiguous. Is this a good ending? A bad ending? Something in the middle? No matter what, we want to show Karlach at the height of her coolness. This is not our goofy dork; this is a powerhouse who knows how to survive, no matter what, and may even have fun this time around. Clint Karlach Eastwood mixed with 80s action star. Bring it on, baby.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: SFX only: A battle cry as Karlach runs toward the imp horde with her axe raised overhead.

5.speaker: Karlach
5.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Hellish scenery - The player steps through a portal into Avernus. Karlach follows behind them, either stepping through, or falling through, in a callback to her recruitment scene (burning).(Her first words since her dying scene.
(She stands up, and the fire calms.)
NodeContext: We're bridging the gap from her death scene here- she was nearly- dead; the player is probably in a high state of emotion and we want to keep the tone high for a moment here.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: It worked. My engine's calmed down.
13.context: NodeContext: (She holds her chest/ inhales. A little emotional, happy to live despite returning to this pit).

21.speaker: Karlach
21.text: I shouldn't have let you come here. This isn't going to be easy, you know. Zariel's going to come at us with everything she's got, and now Raphael's in the mix, too.
21.context: NodeContext: Beginning to bridge into soldier mode, acknowledging the player's sacrifice.

16.speaker: Karlach
16.text: I shouldn't have let you come here. This isn't going to be easy, you know. Zariel's going to come at us with everything she's got.
16.context: NodeContext: Beginning to bridge into soldier mode, acknowledging the player's sacrifice.

18.speaker: Karlach
18.text: Gods. Like clockwork. They'll be on us soon - but there's just enough time.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Shot of horizon - imps scrambling toward her and the player on a distant hill.)

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: Thought I was done with these...
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Digs in her pouch, pulls out two cigars in one hand.NodeContext: A little wistful, a little hardened

0.speaker: Karlach
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: She snaps, and a flame appears at the tip of her finger, lighting the cigar. She offers Wyll a cigar, he shakes his head. She offers the player one of the lit cigars as she speaks. NodeContext: (She snaps, and a flame appears at the tip of her finger. This snap triggers her fully into the current situation. Sadness is gone. Karlach Cliffgate is gone; Karlach Demonsbane is back. She offers Wyll a cigar, he shakes his head. She offers the player one of the lit cigars as she speaks. The subtext here is 'I would never have come back here, but I fucking love you, so let's do this thing together.')

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: Imps are fast but careless. Don't let 'em tire you out - just get rid of 'em. And don't forget:
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach takes a puff of her cigar.NodeContext: (She takes a beat and puffs the cigar. The taste of the smoke brings her back into the Blood War. She gestures to the imps on the horizon with her cigar hand as she speaks; she's done this a thousand times.)

3.speaker: Karlach
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach takes a big drag on the cigar then flicks it across her body.NodeContext: (She puffs the cigar, then tosses it to the ground across her body, cool as fuck. Wryly, before speaking).

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: Better let these fuckers know I'm back. And this time, I'm not alone.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach, the Player, and potentially Wyll prepare to bring the fight to the Hells.NodeContext: (Equips her battle axeand glances at the player with a grin. She's about to run into the horde and kill a shitton of imps and devils. This isn't the life she wanted, but it's all she's got, and she's damn good at it. Fade to credits.)

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: ...but then there was the Blade of Avernus.
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: She snaps, and a flame appears at the tip of her finger, lighting the cigar. She offers Wyll one of the lit cigars as she speaks. NodeContext: (She snaps, and a flame appears at the tip of her finger. This snap triggers her fully into the current situation. Sadness is gone. Karlach Cliffgate is gone; Karlach Demonsbane is back. She hands the player one of the lit cigars as she speaks. The subtext here is 'I would never have come back here, but I fucking love you, so let's do this thing together.')
